metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7351 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in index.php in Shaarli allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the URL to the (1) showRSS, (2) showATOM, or (3) showDailyRSS function; a (4) file name to the importFile function; or (5) vectors related to bookmarks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7351` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

shaarli - 0.0.41betadfsg2-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shaarli package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.0.41betadfsg2-4').
